titles.title: A concurrent resolution to encourage the Congress to ensure that sufficient funds are provided under title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965, as modified by chapter 1 of the Education Consolidation and Improvement Act of 1981, to meet the needs of all eligible educationally disadvantaged students.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

bill.summary: 1/6/1987--Introduced. Declares that it the sense of the Congress that, when reauthorizing appropriations for compensatory education for disadvantaged children (under title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965, as modified by the Education Consolidation and Improvement Act of 1981), the Congress should take into account the number of eligible students who are not served by the program authorized by that title and the additional costs of providing services to them.
